parameters.definition: Minimum demand of hardwood per week
Minimum demand of vinyl planks per week
Minimum total square feet of flooring required to be shipped per week
Maximum hardwood production capacity per week
Maximum vinyl production capacity per week
Profit per square foot of hardwood
Profit per square foot of vinyl

description: A flooring company produces engineered hardwood and vinyl planks. Their sales forecasts show an expected demand of at least \param{MinHardwood} square feet of hardwood and \param{MinVinyl} square feet of vinyl planks each week. To satisfy a shipping contract, a total of at least \param{MinTotalShip} square feet of flooring must be shipped each week. Due to a labor shortage issue, no more than \param{MaxHardwoodProd} square feet of hardwood and \param{MaxVinylProd} square feet of vinyl can be produced weekly. If a square foot of hardwood flooring yields a profit of \param{ProfitHardwood} and a square foot of vinyl planks produces a \param{ProfitVinyl} profit, how many of each type of flooring should be made weekly to maximize the company's profit?
